intro: Ruellia peninsularis, commonly known as the Florida rainflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is often found in wetlands, swales, and other moist habitats, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Ruellia peninsularis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
